description: This course focuses on important issues, images, authors, and modes in an intensive study of racial and multicultural literature in the U.S. The scope of the course can include racial portraiture, sexual politics, field and factory experience, color and class status, and church and family institutions. Authors include such writers as Frederick Douglass and Maxine Hong Kingston. May be repeated if topic is different. Also counts toward and race and ethnic studies major and concentration. Prerequisites: ENGL 185 plus at least two English courses at level II, or permission of the instructor.
name: Top: The Black Radical Tradition
prerequisites: Prerequisites: ENGL 185 plus at least two English courses at level II, or permission of the instructor.
title: Topics in American Racial and Multicultural Literatures
